report.title: Asian Hornet photo missing email
report.description: Warning email sent to Asian Hornet app submissions that have no photo.
report.query: SELECT #columns# FROM occurrences o JOIN samples s ON s.id=o.sample_id AND s.deleted=false JOIN sample_attribute_values vfirstname ON vfirstname.sample_id=s.id AND vfirstname.deleted=false AND vfirstname.sample_attribute_id=6 JOIN sample_attribute_values vsurname ON vsurname.sample_id=s.id AND vsurname.deleted=false AND vsurname.sample_attribute_id=7 JOIN sample_attribute_values vemail ON vemail.sample_id=s.id AND vemail.deleted=false AND vemail.sample_attribute_id=8 LEFT JOIN occurrence_media om ON om.occurrence_id=o.id AND om.deleted=false WHERE o.updated_on>'#date#' AND o.created_on>'#date#' AND s.survey_id=423 AND om.id IS NULL AND o.training=false

param.name: website_id
param.description: ID of website to load occurrences for

column.name: email_body
column.sql:
'

Thank you so much for your report of a yellow-legged (Asian) hornet or nest. Photos of insects and a location must be included for the sighting to be investigated by Government officials. Please keep samples of insects if you have them, as it can be used for official confirmation. If you want help e.g. taking a photograph or to talk through identifying a suspected insect please contact your local Asian hornet Team who may be able to assist.

For further information see So you think you''ve seen a yellow-legged hornet? Â» APHA - National Bee Unit - BeeBase.'
